description: Mansard roof extension to accommodate a unit in multiple occupation (HMO) at third floor level consisting of 4 bedsits (en-suite) with shared communal kitchen, dining and laundry facilities
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 11-007-OS, 11-007-PHO, 11-007-E099, 11-007-E100, 11-007-E101, 11-007-E102, 11-007-E103, 11-007-E200, 11-007-E201, 11-007-E300, 11-007-PHO, 11-007-A099, 11-007-A100, 11-007-A101, 11-007-A102, 11-007-P103, 11-007-P200, 11-007-P201, and 11-007-P300, received 2nd August 2011, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interest of proper planning. | The flank walls of the extension herby permitted shall be built in yellow stock brickwork to match the material use on the existing building  and the mansard roofs shall be clad in natural slates, the finishings to the roof and the windows shall be in lead, whilst the windows shall be timber sliding sash.   Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004). | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the environment and the street scene, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Prior to first occupation of the development, details in line with the criteria specified in SPG 10 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels.  The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and also mitigation of vibration.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of future occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1, and 4.11, and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Details of covered, secure storage for four bicycles shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies 9.1, 9.6 and 9.8 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans and unless otherwise agreed in writing the development shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of Secure By Design and all security measures shall be installed prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of occupiers of the development, in accordance policy 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8. | The development shall only provide 4 units of accommodation in accordance with the layout specified on the submitted drawings and the other rooms shall not be converted  to living accommodation without the prior written permission of the local planning authority.  Reason : To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure a good standard of residential accommodation in the interests of the general amenities of the area and amenities of the occupants in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Unitary Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
